summary: This bill, the Air America Act of 2025, authorizes the Director of the Central Intelligence Agency to provide one-time award payments to eligible individuals who served with Air America (or its affiliated companies) and provided support to the U.S. government between 1950 and 1976.  Awards are for those with qualifying service (over 5 years) and survivors of covered decedents (killed in Southeast Asia). It also establishes a funding limitation, application procedures, and prohibits judicial review of the Director's decisions. The bill aims to recognize and compensate individuals involved in these specific operations.
